item.title: As-Is System Evaluation
item.description:
Cash-based: All portfolios use TS Account's for settlements. Overnight funding default: Unless a term trade is booked, everything funds at ON rate. Manual intervention: Term trades need manual mirror deals.
Reactive controls: Reconciliations run off GL (IM10 & IM19) catch errors after EOD. Limited transparency: True intraday liquidity position not visible to Treasury.
Heavy reliance on Chameleon and GL for operational control.
Exception Management is slow (post-EOD).
No real-time funding attribution[2] (rates not decomposed into base/liquidity). Complex structure of suspense accounts reduces visibility. Treasury’s ability to manage intraday liquidity is constrained.

item.title: Matched Maturity Funding
item.description:
In addition to overnight balances, RMB uses term funding: GM (Global Markets):
Term trades manually booked in Murex using mirror deal functionality.
Ensures GTSY portfolio has matched but opposite position.
FTP rate applied.
IBD / TTS (ZAR):
Term trades booked directly in Chameleon, mirrored to GTSY.
IBD / TTS (Foreign Currency): Moving towards using Murex mirror deals.
Current gap: FTP rates captured, but components (base vs Liquidity Premium) not split.

item.title: Treasury
item.description:
Desks don’t wire cash daily to Treasury. Instead, Treasury applies FTP charges/credits through Chameleon: If a desk has a negative balance → funding expense (charged interest). If a desk has a positive balance → funding income (credited interest).
Daily: Interest accrues in Chameleon on TS balances.[2]
Month-end: Interest is capitalised (posted to P&L).[3] Lifecycle: Trade Day ():
Cashflow hits TS Account. EOD:
Balance charged FTP. onward: accrues daily. Month-end: final interest posting. Desks don’t transfer actual cash to Treasury. The funding cost is deducted from their P&L. When desks price trades, they must include funding costs (FTP) in the client rate. Example: Client loan at 7%. FTP = 6%. Desk margin = 1% (after paying Treasury).

item.title: GTSY Contra Entries
item.description: For every debit in a desk’s TS Account, there is a contra credit in GTSY’s central funding portfolio (Dept FND). This ensures that GTSY “stands in the middle” of all funding. Example: If Desk borrows 100m → Desk TS account -100m, GTSY +100m.

item.title: Simple Process Flow
item.description:
Trade → TS Account → GTSY Contra → Payment → Nostro Trade booked in Trading System → theoretical cashflow.
Cashflow sent to Chameleon → updates TS Account. Chameleon calculates overnight interest.
GTSY records the opposite funding entry.
Calypso processes payment → external Nostro account settles. Oracle EBS records P&L, funding clearing, interdepartmental funding, payment clearing, Nostro clearing.
